title: How to Make Rack of Lamb - Cooking with Greggy
description:
For the season finale of Cooking with Greggy, learn how to make this very easy and impressive looking rack of lamb!

From the Blue Apron Cookbook…
INGREDIENTS
1 rack of lamb (7 or 8 bones, about 1.5 pounds)
1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil, plus 2 teaspoons for drizzling
Kosher salt and black pepper
1 clove garlic, finely grated into a paste
1/4 cup Dijon mustard
1.5 tablespoons finely chopped fresh tarragon leaves
1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs
1 large egg white, beaten

1) Pat the lamb dry with paper towels. Drizzle with the 2 teaspoons olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and let stand 30 minutes.
2) Preheat oven to 450 degrees.
3) In a bowl combine with garlic paste, mustard, 1 tablespoon of olive oil, tarragon, breadcrumbs, salt, and pepper.
4) Using a pastry brush, brush the outer side of the lamb with the egg white. Coat the lamb in the breadcrumb mixture, pressing to adhere.
5) Transfer the lamb -- breadcrumb side up -- to a wire rack on a sheet pan. Roast for 28 to 30 minutes until the breadcrumbs have browned and the meat registers 140 degrees with a thermometer. Let rest 15 minutes.
6) Slice and pray.
